name: volt-phalcon-language
description: Snippets, Syntax Highlighting, Hover, Completion, and Formatting for Volt

volt-phalcon-language.completionsVoltCus.description: Whether to enable/disable service Volt custom by application.

volt-phalcon-language.formatting.description: Whether to enable/disable Volt PrettyDiff formatting.

volt-phalcon-language.braceLine.description: If true an empty line will be inserted after opening curly braces and before closing curly braces.

volt-phalcon-language.bracePadding.description: Inserts a space after the start of a container and before the end of the container if the contents of that container are not indented; such as: conditions, function arguments, and escaped sequences of template strings.

volt-phalcon-language.braceStyle.description: Emulates JSBeautify's brace_style option using existing Pretty Diff options.

volt-phalcon-language.braces.description: Determines if opening curly braces will exist on the same line as their condition or be forced onto a new line.

volt-phalcon-language.commentLine.description: If a blank new line should be forced above comments.

volt-phalcon-language.comments.description: This will determine whether comments should always start at position 0 of each line or if comments should be indented according to the code.

volt-phalcon-language.compressedCss.description: If CSS should be beautified in a style where the properties and values are minifed for faster reading of selectors.

volt-phalcon-language.correct.description: Automatically correct some sloppiness in code.

volt-phalcon-language.cssInsertLines.description: Inserts new line characters between every CSS code block.

volt-phalcon-language.elseLine.description: If else_line is true then the keyword 'else' is forced onto a new line.

volt-phalcon-language.endComma.description: If there should be a trailing comma in arrays and objects. Value multiline only applies to modes beautify and diff.

volt-phalcon-language.forceAttribute.description: If all markup attributes should be indented each onto their own line.

volt-phalcon-language.forceIndent.description: Will force indentation upon all content and tags without regard for the creation of new text nodes.

volt-phalcon-language.formatArray.description: Determines if all array indexes should be indented, never indented, or left to the default.

volt-phalcon-language.formatObject.description: Determines if all object keys should be indented, never indented, or left to the default.

volt-phalcon-language.functionName.description: If a space should follow a JavaScript function name.

volt-phalcon-language.indentStyle.description: Choose to indent using tabs or spaces.

volt-phalcon-language.indentLevel.description: How much indentation padding should be applied to beautification? This option is internally used for code that requires switching between libraries.

volt-phalcon-language.tabSize.description: 0 will default to the editor's tab size. Stores the number of 'inchar' values to comprise a single indentation.

volt-phalcon-language.methodChain.description: When to break consecutively chained methods and properties onto separate lines. A negative value disables this option. A value of 0 ensures method chains are never broken.

volt-phalcon-language.neverFlatten.description: If destructured lists in script should never be flattend.

volt-phalcon-language.newLine.description: Insert an empty line at the end of output.

volt-phalcon-language.noCaseIndent.description: If a case statement should receive the same indentation as the containing switch block.

volt-phalcon-language.noLeadZero.description: Whether leading 0s in CSS values immediately preceeding a decimal should be removed or prevented.

volt-phalcon-language.objectSort.description: Sorts markup attributes and properties by key name in script and style.

volt-phalcon-language.preserve.description: The maximum number of consecutive empty lines to retain.

volt-phalcon-language.preserveComment.description: Prevent comment reformatting due to option wrap.

volt-phalcon-language.quoteConvert.description: If the quotes of script strings or markup attributes should be converted to single quotes or double quotes.

volt-phalcon-language.space.description: Inserts a space following the function keyword for anonymous functions.

volt-phalcon-language.spaceClose.description: Markup self-closing tags end will end with ' />' instead of '/>'.

volt-phalcon-language.tagMerge.description: Allows immediately adjacement start and end markup tags of the same name to be combined into a single self-closing tag.

volt-phalcon-language.tagSort.description: Sort child items of each respective markup parent element.

volt-phalcon-language.ternaryLine.description: If ternary operators in JavaScript ? and : should remain on the same line.

volt-phalcon-language.unformatted.description: If markup tags should have their insides preserved. This option is only available to markup and does not support child tokens that require a different lexer.

volt-phalcon-language.variableList.description: If consecutive JavaScript variables should be merged into a comma separated list or if variables in a list should be separated.

volt-phalcon-language.vertical.description: If lists of assignments and properties should be vertically aligned. This option is not used with the markup lexer.

volt-phalcon-language.wrap.description: Character width limit before applying word wrap. A 0 value disables this option. A negative value concatenates script strings.
